thread.title: On the go: Haunting season is underway
thread.title_full: On the go: Haunting season is underway - Houston Chronicle

author: chron.com
title: On the go: Haunting season is underway
text:
Photo: Eddy Matchette, Freelance Image 1 of / 4 4 The Fort Bend County Fair runs ends its 10-day run on Sunday.﻿
Photo: Eddy Matchette, Freelance The Fort Bend County Fair runs ends its 10-day run on Sunday.﻿ Image 2 of 4 A turkey sits in a pen at the Fort Bend County Fair & Rodeo.
Photo: Melissa Phillip, Staff A turkey sits in a pen at the Fort Bend County Fair & Rodeo. Image 3 of 4 Mykel Gibson of Hibbing, MN sets up stuffed animal prizes at a basketball throw game on the carnival midway at the Fort Bend County Fair & Rodeo, 4310 Hwy. 36 South in Rosenberg Sunday, Sept. 28, 2014, in Rosenberg. The Fort Bend County Fair & Rodeo continues through Oct. 5. ( Melissa Phillip / Houston Chronicle )
Photo: Melissa Phillip, Staff Mykel Gibson of Hibbing, MN sets up stuffed animal prizes at a... Image 4 of 4 Trenton Steinfeld of Rosenberg used his brother's pig named Diesel as a pillow at the 2014 edition of the Fort Bend County Fair & Rodeo.
Photo: Melissa Phillip, Staff Trenton Steinfeld of Rosenberg used his brother's pig named Diesel... On the go: Haunting season is underway 1 / 4 Back to Gallery Fort Bend County Fair
Tracy Byrd and Cory Morrow are among the entertainers as the Fort Bend County Fair wraps up its 10-day run. Festivities include a wine garden, rodeo and carnival.
When: 5 p.m.-midnight Thursday and Friday, noon-midnight Saturday and noon-8 p.m. Sunday
Where: 4310 Texas 36 S., Rosenberg
Tickets: $15, $5 for ages 6-11; fortbendcountyfair.com
Foam Wonderland
Expect a stunning laser show, thunderous bass and some of the country's best electronic DJs when Foam Wonderland takes over Minute Maid Park. While the dance party might heat up, it will be nothing the world's largest foam machines can't cool off. Ages 16 and older only.
When: 4 p.m. Saturday
Where: 501 Crawford
Tickets: starting at $32.50; foamwonderland.com
Sobering comedy
Comics Jose Sarduy , Shayla Rivera and Jay Lafarr will take the stage at the Hamill Foundation Conference Center when the Sober Recreation Committee presents "Addicted to Comedy." SRC organizes social events for people who are recovering from addictions. Proceeds will benefit SRC.
When: 8 p.m. Saturday
Where: 303 Jackson Hill
Tickets: $20-$30; srchouston.org
Waller County Fair
Live music, a rodeo and a carnival midway are among the highlights of this old-school community event held at the Waller County Fairgrounds .
When: 6-11 p.m. Thursday and Friday and 10 a.m.-1 a.m. Saturday
Where: 22000 Fairground Road, Hempstead
Tickets: $10; wallercountyfair.org
Haunted houses
Things go bump in the night more often in October. Get your fright on at these area haunted houses:
Creepy Hollow: 12872 Valley Vista, Rosharon; 800-357-3323, creepyhollowhauntedhouse.com
Haunted House at the National Museum of Funeral History : 415 Barren Springs; 281-876-3063, nmfh.org
Haunted Mayfield Manor: 2313 Harborside, Galveston; 409-762-6677, hauntedmayfieldmanor.com
Haunted Trails: 11500 Antoine; 713-618-3323, thehauntedtrails.com
Kingwood Asylum & Hallowed Grounds: 1963 N. Park , Kingwood; 936-524-2975; kingwoodasylum.com
Nightmare on the Bayou: 1515 Studemont; 716-868-3344, nightmareonthebayou.com
Redrum Haunt: 1800 E. U.S. 90A, Richmond; redrumhaunt.com
Screamworld: 2225 N. Sam Houston Parkway; 713-914-1313, screamworld.com
Terror Dome: 16020 I-10 E., Channelview; 281-860-9800, houstonterrordome.com
